body: Isolate mitochondria by gently crushing 40 to 80 flies in a 10 ml Kontes homogenizer with 7 strokes of the pestle in 3 ml homogenization buffer consisting of 225 mM mannitol, 75 mM sucrose, 10 mM MOPS, 1 mM EGTA, 0.5% BSA, pH 7.2 at 4°C 38.
Filter the extracts through 8 layers of cheese cloth, and then centrifuge at 300 x G for 3 min in a Beckman Avantis-J25.
Centrifuge the supernatant at 6000 x G for 10 min to obtain a mitochondrial pellet.
Measure the mitochondrial protein concentration by the Bradford method, using Bio-Rad reagents, corrected for the BSA content in the homogenization buffer.

Determine the respiration rates by measuring oxygen consumption using a Clark-type electrode and metabolic chamber containing 0.65 ml of reaction buffer consisting of 225 mM mannitol, 75 mM sucrose, 10 mM KCl, 10 mM Tris-HCl, 5 mM KH<sub>2</sub>PO<sub>4</sub>, pH 7.2 at 25°C.
Calculate the mitochondrial ATP production rates from ADP consumption rates during state III respiration.
